bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Master Sergeant Williams, December 27, 1947

div1.p: Hench thanks Williams for his help during Hench's and Lawrence Reed's recent visit to the Army War College, where they located the room in which Walter Reed died.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Master Sergeant Williams, December 27, 1947
div1.opener:
December 27, 1947
Master Sergeant Williams
Quarters 31-A
Army War College
Washington 25, D. C.
My dear Sergeant Williams:
div1.p:
I appreciate greatly the help you gave me
on my recent visit with General Walter L. Reed, to
the room on the second floor of building 56-B, in
which room the famous American medical officer and
physician, Walter Reed, died.

I thought you would be interested to know
a little more about this story and about what Doctor
Reed accomplished. I am therefore sending you by
separate post a reprint which I hope will interest
you.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
